tweets.text: @PJennings88 @EnvAgency Is there a link to the application or is it the normal restriction of ‚ÄúYou have to make an appointment to visit the local EA office to view the application‚Äù?

Over six years ago we predicted HS2 would make their application to @EnvAgency to approve tunnelling at the last moment and sure enough they have. Why did they do this? purely to avoid public scrutiny of this highly dubious activity that puts rivers and drinking water at risk.

tweets.text:
Last week we spent the day at Smithills in #Bolton with our partners @WoodlandTrust @merseyforest & @ThatsManchester

Here log dams & 90000 üå≥ are helping to reduce #flood risk for communities & create habitat for local wildlife

Watch the full interview üëâhttps://t.co/j5fPgJOl42 https://t.co/2LTyCWX14O

Square this circle: 7K people: Walleys stinks. Lafarge: Yep, Walleys landfill smells, sorry we'll try and address it. @RedIndustries2: our rotting rubbish definitely doesn't smell, must be something else.  @EnvAgencyMids: what smell? #stopTheStink @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL

After @OBrightFuture & @EnvAgency event last week, @ukyouth4nature adds to the voices of young people with their own campaign focusing on freshwater habitats where wildlife is #DeadInTheWater & vanishing.

Their message = Urgent support & action is needed to #RestoreOurRivers https://t.co/p0Km92BfA3

@maricaoneill @EnvAgencyMids @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @StinkStopthe @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL Totally agree. If it‚Äôs innocent & non-hazardous to human health please let us know. The community are on their knees with anxiety over what they are breathing in from these poisonous fumes @StinkStopthe @RedIndustries2
It‚Äôs such a part of our daily lives now that we even have a stink shanty!! @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe https://t.co/dXc2PdYcND

tweets.text: Can @ChichesterDC and @EnvAgencySE really GUARANTEE  that they will be able to technically &  financially defend Chichester‚Äôs coast  for the next 2-3 generations? Understand the @EnvAgency have received an application from HS2 to approve the environmental permit to allow them to start tunnelling. We are told by the @EnvAgency that this is not be open for consultancy even through there is significant risk to our rivers and water supply.
Our field team in #Nottinghamshire are working on repairing & reseeding #flood damaged banks on the River Idle near Retford #floodaware https://t.co/vcpJIdZZjU

#FCERM #Flood #ClimateChange https://t.co/EpeTBZWbf0
A real concern that the @EnvAgency approval for HS2 Tunnelling will be pushed through without adequate scrutiny. https://t.co/b5o9gOr7mR

@Krisp06 @Chilternstreams @EnvAgency On average 6 million litres/day. But if something goes wrong like losing all the drilling fluids or cement into the chalk aquifer significantly more.  If the @EnvAgency want to know if anything has gone wrong all they will need is access to the HS2 water consumption records.

@networkrail @IanSnakeGeek @EnvAgencySE That sounds fantastic. Could you share the survey that was done before this work? It will be of great interest to our.local ecologists and environmental groups to help protect wildlife corridors around the site. Also any mitigations taken in this instance?

#FCERM investment of ¬£5.2B from 2021-27 will protect a further 330,000 properties. Funding for more innovative, adaptable projects that increase #flood #resilience too! https://t.co/IzbWNJcwVI
@EnvAgency @GOVUK #SuDS #PFR #floodrisk #floodaware https://t.co/0Evi9oW4kn
It has been great to be part of this excellent work #TeamEA #Flood @EnvAgency Reduced flood risk really does relieve anxiety and give health benefits. https://t.co/jkR6ktsvMq

This shocking picture is a yard filled with illegally dumped construction and demolition waste. #WasteCrime harms our environment and economy. Make sure you dispose of construction waste legally, or risk being fined up to ¬£50,000 or face jail.

Read more: https://t.co/wMYPlu9tFt https://t.co/jE9enBIM9Z

@DobbyWoods @IanSnakeGeek @EnvAgencySE Hi there. We are dedicated to minimising our impact on wildlife. Our in-house ecologists work alongside external experts to carry out detailed surveys before work commences, helping us to identify the animals, insects and plants in the area that might be affected by our work. ^MS

We have removed an estimated two million Argulus eggs, (fish louse), from a fishery in #Norfolk in the last two years.

Argulus can cause distress and in some cases death to the fish.  

This thread explains how you can spot them and what to do when you doüëá #Fishing #Anglers https://t.co/W68cRQgwnH

tweets.text:
Are you doing the right thing with building site waste? Waste criminals often take this waste and dump it illegally.

You're responsible for your waste even if you pass it to someone else. Follow these 4 simple steps to protect yourself from #WasteCrime:
https://t.co/ReD1Pr8Zi5 https://t.co/CxKPluz6cG

As bad as the stink is (and it's bad) the greater worry is what it indicates. That residents around #WalleysQuarry are breathing Hydrogen Sulfide every day. Thousands of people. Hundreds of children. @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/Ztm5kuIOnO

For those concerned about the risk to the chalk aquifer  caused by HS2 tunnelling we need access to see the details the environmental approval application lodged with the @EnvAgency recently. The contact email would be enquiries@environment-agency.gov.uk.

Last week our Rivers Team @LYR_Shropshire helped to plant 8,000 trees near Clun, creating habitat, a #carbonstore & slowing the flow. These oaks replace conifers planted 50 years ago, despite the site being ancient woodland.
Funded by @EnvAgency, planted by Cashmore Contracting https://t.co/YfjkVxQoBI
